content.label: Gameplay, art/design and sound are all excellent. The mythology and story behind the game is excellent as well. I’m playing through for the second or third time now. My new iPad doesn’t want to play the game’s sound though, which is a letdown. This problem carried over to the version on my phone, so now I’m resigned to playing through without music, dialogue or sound. I’m looking forward to finishing 2 and 3 anyways!
Top kek
I’ve been gaming since there were video games. Seen a lot of crap. This one was a bit short, but all heart. Well done.

title.label: After all the $ update for iPhone x

content.label: See above
This is great. Never played anything like it. Amazing art and story.
The screen is small can barely read the story and choose icons.

title.label: Not for iPhone X or above

content.label: This is not optimized for newer phones. As a result, everything is extremely small. Text is impossible to read.
Very much worth it, great game in every aspect.
All what see when open game - black screen
Better to watch some YouTube tutorials before you get started.

title.label: Actual game no in app purchases

content.label: Difficult game with Perma death. Amazeballs

The artwork is a absolutely stunning and the story is intricate and interactive. If you’re a fan of any fire emblem style combat type game, banner saga puts its own unique twist to that style of gameplay. All in all I can’t wait for Banner Saga 3 to come to Mobile. Hurry Please!!!
Cannot wait for part three to come out in the iPad
Very fun to play. Robust gameplay and awesome storyline. Lovin’ it!
Game is beautiful, but you cant really tell on an iphone. Best played on the ipad or bigger
Wow, great game, memorable journey. Buy it, you won’t regret it.

title.label: Loved it but just freezes on loading screen.

content.label: I played through once. This game is amazing. Unfortunately, I re-downloaded to play through again, but it just freezes on a loading screen after showing the studio logo. Super bummed. What’s the fix?
Played it once through and enjoyed it. Now it won’t load for subsequent play. “Loading” screen just goes on for minutes and won’t open game.

I wanted to write this for a few reasons.
This game is too involved for a casual gameplay experience. So if you want to be casual, then don’t get this on the iPhone. 

Basically it’s Oregon trail, mixed with some nice battles, except the battles really aren’t your classic rpg. 
You have a ton of characters that you have no idea how to use them, and the game just tells you to read their biography to figure it out. 
So you really don’t feel connected to the characters or their abilities.
You take turns with the enemy, so even if you tactfully beat an enemy so you can get an advantage, guess what, the gameplay doesn’t care and it’s their turn, so why bother to be tactful. Just read their bios and kill everything, and take turns doing it, and then continue your Oregon trail.

If you get this on iPhone you will want to skip the text because that’s what iPhones let you do. You’re just taking a quick 30 min lunch break to play a game, but end up watching your caravan keep moving left until you get in a battle.

This games a waste of 10 bucks.
Wonderfully addicting!

title.label: Unoptimized for iPhone X and newer

content.label:
If you are using an iPhone X, XS, or XR the game is “letterboxed” on your phone. On my XS Max there is a massive amount of wasted space on the screen with black bars all the way around. 

I’d be less bothered by this if the text and buttons weren’t also so tiny you need a magnifying glass to read any of it and a finger like a toothpick to interact with anything. I have no idea how this passed QA or Apple review.

This was a complete waste of $10. If I can’t read, see, or interact with anything because it’s all so small, what is even the point?
Give it a try. The story is immersive. Creative. Beautiful illustrations. Love the marriage of old and new.

title.label: One of the best games on the App Store

content.label: Banner Saga started as a PC game and the move to iOS was great.  If you buy one game buy this one

Can’t decide if it’s a good game or not. I can only play for around 10 minutes before the sound and music goes out. I deleted then downloaded again and the same problem continues. Kind of disappointed that I paid 10 bucks for a game that I can’t enjoy. Any advice?
I can't finish this game. I get way too invested in the characters. I feel like that's a weak review, but it's a really good game.

title.label: Excellent Port. I now have 3 copies of these games.

content.label: I have the Banner Saga Games on steam, got them on twitch through being an amazon prime member, and i now have them on ios. excellent games great ports banner saga 3 lets go

Easily one of the best games ever on iPad. Gorgeous artwork and a compelling storyline replete with twists based upon a player's leadership decisions. Couple that with a turn-based strategic battle system that rewards foresight, team synergy, and thoughtful use of limited upgrade points and items, and you've got a dead lock winner. The range of characters and abilities allow lots of experimentation and the dynamic storyline often leaves you wondering if you could've handled a situation better, giving the game very high replay value. My only complaint is that the story ended hahaha. On to part 2, and hoping for an iOS version of part 3 soon!
Game just look way to small on a large screen
Update is needed for iPhone X Screen is too small

There seems to be no way to backtrack from the Preparing 
For Battle scene, there’s way too much story written for the author’s self-gratification, and when you hold on a char’s stat, there’s no explanation about what the stat does! Oh, my Broken Chain is now at 3? How exciting -_-

title.label: Very poor performance on iPhone 6s, can’t even play on iPhone X

content.label: As the title says, somehow it just doesn’t work.

This game was nice. I was looking for a game similar to fire emblem and was originally disappointed at the gameplay so it sat in my phone for awhile before giving it another chance. 
As I got into it more I realized how similar it is to a childhood favorite, Oregon Trail. I eventually beat the game. It was the right amount of challenging and the story was interesting enough to keep me coming back. 
My only grime was I didn’t love the characters. They just didn’t do it for me. Maybe it was the dry cliche dialect, idk. 
In all it was a good enough time to garnish 4 stars from me tho perhaps that’s being generous. 
I do intend to play the second one tho.
High quality
Keeps crashing
thats pretty good
Why does a game I paid for have ads?

Stoic has presented a beautiful game with interesting character development and a cool unique art style. Combat however can be a nightmare. Moves are turn based and movement is tile based with locked decisions Incase you misclick. There are odd combat features including enemies being able to move past you without opportunity attacks and odd ranged attacks which can shoot far straight but only half the distance diagonally in certain cases. I found the whole thing to be a bit clunky which is a shame because the story is phenomenal and the game does a great job at keeping you hooked and always on your back foot ensuring you never feel too powerful. All in all I think this brings the game to a 3/5 for me as it’s less of a game and more an interactive story.

I was Skeptical at first paying more than usual for an iOS game but WOW worth every penny. The only thing I would like to see is more backstory and details just to better understand the surroundings when you first begin. But wow what an adventure. Great work.
Please fix for the iPhone X love the game will not play it until it’s fix. Thank you

title.label: Needs bigger text during decision making.

content.label: iPhone 6s+. The text during crucial decision making is too small I’ve fat thumbed into some terrible situations. Maybe enlarged text when choosing would be better. Other than that, awesome game. Very entertaining.

name.label: 1 a song of fire and ice

content.label: Visually stunning, with a very dynamic and fun combat system. A game worth 5 stars
Fun head puzzle, interesting story. Would recommend.

It takes a bit to get used to, it’s better on an iPad but I primarily play on my phone. Definitely worth the price, very replayable. If you’ve just started, and are frustrated, keep playing, make mistakes, you’ll get the hang of it and then it’s truly enjoyable. My favorite pass time and I play before bed often. Amazing art, interesting story and combat mechanics, and stunning soundtrack! I love this game! Will get the second and third when it comes out ❤️

title.label: Love the game but no longer works

content.label: I love banner saga I play it on multiple platforms however I took a long break from my iPad version now it doesn’t get past loading. Tried multiple times to start it up but even after multiple 30 minute waits I just ended up deleting the game until I hear of a fix.

Solid game. Beautiful and unique art and animations. Not a very complex RPG (you feel pressed into a certain scenario instead of being able to choose your own destiny). Interesting sound track. Game mechanics are good but in-fight match designs are a bit bogus every now and then. Gripping story. 

Overall a very good game that I’m currently replaying a year after I bought it. Would definitely recommend!

Almost a great game but it’s broken. I make progress past 3 or 4 fights then when I go back I am back where I started. Also don’t like the unnecessary traffic jam. Players should be able to walk trough friendliest. Also don’t like forced turn sequence. Every turn sequence someone should be able to decide who moves first.
It would be awesome if you guys update the game to fit the iPhone X screen.  Thanks!

title.label: Too short and not enough battles

content.label: The game is slow, way too much talking.  Needs more battles and less talking/traveling around.

title.label: One of the Best Games I’ve Ever Played

content.label: It’s not an exaggeration. Honestly. While only about 5-6 hours long it is so good. Art style, combat, story, music, and decision-making are all exceptionally fantastic. Easily 10/10.

I’ve always been intrigued by this game but only recently picked it up, and now I can’t put it down. I enjoy everything about the game; the story, art, music, all drew me in and made me interested in the lore, and characters of this world. I don’t write reviews very often but this is one I felt needed to be made. I plan on playing the second game ASAP
